title: WHIRLING F1 / THE GARDENER MAIN
description: The Gardener turns out to be a Union fixer. Slightly different model and portrait. Short *smug* dialogue directing you to Hardie, referencing last dialogue.

dialogueTree.title: Elizabeth: ""I've got nothing to say to you. Wh..."
dialogueTree.text: "I've got nothing to say to you. Why are you wasting your time?" She crosses her arms.

links.title: You: ""Hey. Can I borrow your gardening g..."
links.text: "Hey. Can I borrow your gardening gloves?"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""No.""
links.text: "No."

links.title: You: ""I have a cadaver situation. I woul..."
links.text: "I have a cadaver situation. I would really appreciate it."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""My answer is no.""
links.text: "My answer is no."

links.title: Titus Hardie: ""C'mon Lizzie." The big man takes a..."
links.text: "C'mon Lizzie." The big man takes a sip of beer. "We're generous people here in Martinaise. With *property*."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Wow -- really? A political moment?..."
links.text: Wow -- really? A political moment? Now?

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Fine." She hands you her pair of y..."
links.text: "Fine." She hands you her pair of yellow gardening gloves.

links.title: You: ""Thank you comrade. Property is the..."
links.text: "Thank you comrade. Property is theft."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Vulgar idiot," she shakes her head..."
links.text: "Vulgar idiot," she shakes her head.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Your understanding of the worker's..."
links.text: Your understanding of the worker's struggle is about one century old, she's thinking.

links.title: You: ""You shouldn't have assisted me lik..."
links.text: "You shouldn't have assisted me like that. I am your enemy. Nature is struggle."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""You're right. I shouldn't have.""
links.text: "You're right. I shouldn't have."

links.title: You: ""I didn't deserve this handout. You..."
links.text: "I didn't deserve this handout. You should've forced me to *hustle* harder."

links.title: Titus Hardie: ""Don't thank her -- thank me.""
links.text: "Don't thank her -- thank me."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Another day -- hustlin' and grindin..."
links.text: Another day -- hustlin' and grindin' in the free world!

links.title: You: ""Thank you.""
links.text: "Thank you."

links.title: Titus Hardie: ""Don't thank her -- thank me.""
links.text: "Don't thank her -- thank me."

links.title: Shanky: ""Yeah, don't you forget -- T did yo..."
links.text: "Yeah, don't you forget -- T did you a favour, popo."

links.title: You: ""Okay.""
links.text: "Okay."

links.title: Elizabeth: "She doesn't say anything."
links.text: She doesn't say anything.

links.title: You: ""Are you the eighth Hardie boy -- A..."
links.text: "Are you the eighth Hardie boy -- A Hardie girl?"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""I am not," she says dryly."
links.text: "I am not," she says dryly.

links.title: Glen: ""You *could* be, Liz. You could be..."
links.text: "You *could* be, Liz. You could be anything. You could even be a model."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""*Even* a mod..." Her face stiffens..."
links.text: "*Even* a mod..." Her face stiffens. "Glen, I went to *law school*. I am an attorney."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "He's right, with a face like that s..."
links.text: He's right, with a face like that she could be on the cover of La Débutante International.

links.title: You: ""He's right, you know? You're very..."
links.text: "He's right, you know? You're very pretty."

links.title: Elizabeth: "The cold look in her eyes speaks lo..."
links.text: The cold look in her eyes speaks louder than words: she is not amused.

links.title: Drama: "It's not her. She's not a Hardie gi..."
links.text: It's not her. She's not a Hardie girl. Definitely.

links.title: You: ""Get a grip Glen. She went to law s..."
links.text: "Get a grip Glen. She went to law school."

links.title: Glen: ""So fucking what? Lots of models ar..."
links.text: "So fucking what? Lots of models are actually really smart people, fuckwad!"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""No, Glen -- they aren't." Her tone..."
links.text: "No, Glen -- they aren't." Her tone is cold and uninvolved.

links.title: Rhetoric: "This didn't change her opinion of y..."
links.text: This didn't change her opinion of you.

links.title: You: ""Okay, let's change the topic.""
links.text: "Okay, let's change the topic."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Please do.""
links.text: "Please do."

links.title: You: ""I guess you're not a winner after..."
links.text: "I guess you're not a winner after all."

links.title: Elizabeth: "She shrugs. Almost no reaction."
links.text: She shrugs. Almost no reaction.

links.title: Volition: "It's in there. She's just stonewall..."
links.text: It's in there. She's just stonewalling.

links.title: You: ""The obscene sign. You said you wou..."
links.text: "The obscene sign. You said you would clean it.

links.title: Elizabeth: ""This is about your alcoholism, isn..."
links.text: "This is about your alcoholism, isn't it? People talk." She squints. "I have no patience for it. Or pity."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "A cheap deflection, but brutal. Thi..."
links.text: A cheap deflection, but brutal. This did not have the effect you desired, but it did *something*.

links.title: You: ""The sign is going to have to clean..."
links.text: "The sign is going to have to clean itself then?"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""I have heard about your *medical c..."
links.text: "I have heard about your *medical condition*. People talk. And I have no patience for it. Or pity."

links.title: You: ""This is not winner attitude, citiz..."
links.text: "This is not winner attitude, citizen." (Shake your head.)

links.title: Elizabeth: ""I have heard about your *medical c..."
links.text: "I have heard about your *medical condition*. People talk. And I have no patience for it. Or pity."

links.title: You: ""What's your role in all this?""
links.text: "What's your role in all this?"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Like I already told you, I'm a leg..."
links.text: "Like I already told you, I'm a legal counsellor." She crosses her arms. "Do you have hearing problems?"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Obviously I'm a lawyer. A legal co..."
links.text: "Obviously I'm a lawyer. A legal counsellor for the Dockworkers' Union." She crosses her arms. "I would urge you to consider what you say to my clients."

links.title: You: ""Are you Lizzy -- Elizabeth -- Miss..."
links.text: "Are you Lizzy -- Elizabeth -- Miss Beaufort?"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""I suggest not wasting time on triv..."
links.text: "I suggest not wasting time on trivial pleasantries and focusing on why you are actually here -- Titus Hardie," she points to the tall man by the table.

links.title: Composure: "Even though she has excellent contr..."
links.text: Even though she has excellent control over her self, something moved behind her eyes, in the way she stands, in her face...

links.title: Authority: "You caught her off guard. Push her..."
links.text: You caught her off guard. Push her some more.

links.title: You: ""Easy Leo told me about you, he lik..."
links.text: "Easy Leo told me about you, he likes to talk a lot."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""You're not here to chat up the leg..."
links.text: "You're not here to chat up the legal counsel, you're here to question these men."

links.title: Authority: "You set the pace and the topic of t..."
links.text: You set the pace and the topic of these conversations here. Establish that.

links.title: Drama: "A man like Easy Leo could have said..."
links.text: A man like Easy Leo could have said anything. Do not be restrained, sire.

links.title: You: ""He said Mr. Evrart sent you to law..."
links.text: "He said Mr. Evrart sent you to law school?"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""I represent the Union and these me..."
links.text: "I represent the Union and these men here." She points to the crew around the table. "Don't make this personal."

links.title: Authority: "A very minor victory."
links.text: A very minor victory.

links.title: You: ""He said you were in debt to Mr. Cl..."
links.text: "He said you were in debt to Mr. Claire."

links.title: You: ""He said you're the Union fixer. Yo..."
links.text: "He said you're the Union fixer. You fix things."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""I am a *legal counsel*," she inton..."
links.text: "I am a *legal counsel*," she intones. "Don't make this personal."

links.title: You: ""He said you're Mr. Evrart's *Doux..."
links.text: "He said you're Mr. Evrart's *Doux et Sucré* Death Machine."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""He said no such thing." She accide..."
links.text: "He said no such thing." She accidentally raises her voice. "This isn't about me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Calm down everyone. Let's stay pro..."
links.text: "Calm down everyone. Let's stay professional."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Dirty tactics, officer."
links.text: Dirty tactics, officer.

links.title: Authority: "She shut you down -- because you do..."
links.text: She shut you down -- because you don't have enough backbone.

links.title: You: ""Hardie? Not yet, I had another que..."
links.text: "Hardie? Not yet, I had another question."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""No. Talk to Titus.""
links.text: "No. Talk to Titus."

links.title: You: ""What if I want to talk to *you*, n..."
links.text: "What if I want to talk to *you*, not Titus?"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""What you want is of no significanc..."
links.text: "What you want is of no significance, *officer*. Don't test your authority -- in Martinaise you are no one."

links.title: Authority: "I saw what you were thinking. You w..."
links.text: I saw what you were thinking. You want to say 'what are you going to *do* to me?'. Don't. Just because it's in your head doesn't mean you have to say it.

links.title: Volition: "You will not lose out on anything g..."
links.text: You will not lose out on anything good by not saying it.

links.title: You: ""Be straight with me, what kind of..."
links.text: "Be straight with me, what kind of music *do* you listen to?"

links.title: Elizabeth: "She looks as if pondering whether t..."
links.text: She looks as if pondering whether to answer or not... but then shakes her head slightly.

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Anodic dance music, you wouldn't g..."
links.text: "Anodic dance music, you wouldn't get it."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Not only do you *get it* -- you kno..."
links.text: Not only do you *get it* -- you know it.

links.title: You: ""Hold on, of course I *get it*. It'..."
links.text: "Hold on, of course I *get it*. It's a progressive soundscape, mixing nomadic rhythms with pop melodies."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Okay, you have a dictionary. That..."
links.text: "Okay, you have a dictionary. That doesn't mean you get it..."

links.title: You: ""Dance music -- basically disco? I..."
links.text: "Dance music -- basically disco? I know all about it."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""No," she steadies her breathing. "..."
links.text: "No," she steadies her breathing. "Not disco. Disco is *undead*."

links.title: You: ""The hell it is.""
links.text: "The hell it is."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""I guess it's fair to say you guys..."
links.text: "I guess it's fair to say you guys have it on life support."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean *us guys*?""
links.text: "What do you mean *us guys*?"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Hjelmdallermen.""
links.text: "Hjelmdallermen."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Hjelmdallermen is a reference to th..."
links.text: Hjelmdallermen is a reference to the *Northern* themed action-adventure series, Man From... Actually, this is less than helpful right now. I'll just get out of the way.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Sorry."
links.text: Sorry.

links.title: You: ""Oh, you're a hjelmdaller-head?""
links.text: "Oh, you're a hjelmdaller-head?"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""No." It doesn't look like she's in..."
links.text: "No." It doesn't look like she's into popular adventure-fantasy.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "A left jab, right in the looker."
links.text: A left jab, right in the looker.

links.title: You: ""A lot of people out there apprecia..."
links.text: "A lot of people out there appreciate a good disco breakdown."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""I. Don't. Care.""
links.text: "I. Don't. Care."

links.title: You: ""Okay, stick with your opinion.""
links.text: "Okay, stick with your opinion."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""I will." It doesn't look like you..."
links.text: "I will." It doesn't look like you changed her mind.

links.title: You: ""You know, maybe you're right.""
links.text: "You know, maybe you're right."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Look, we're not discussing your ta..."
links.text: "Look, we're not discussing your taste in music anymore, officer. Do you have questions for my clients or not?"

links.title: You: ""You're right. I don't know anythin..."
links.text: "You're right. I don't know anything about anything. What is anodic music?"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""It's beyond the horizon for you.""
links.text: "It's beyond the horizon for you."

links.title: Empathy: "You will never be able to experienc..."
links.text: You will never be able to experience it the way she does. She's even a bit sad about it; then the feeling passes.

links.title: Conceptualization: "She means it's part of the future y..."
links.text: She means it's part of the future you won't experience.

links.title: You: "What if I want to, it's in my mind..."
links.text: What if I want to, it's in my mind for some reason...

links.title: Conceptualization: "There is nothing a determined man c..."
links.text: There is nothing a determined man could not achieve.

links.title: You: "Yeah, I don't care about that."
links.text: Yeah, I don't care about that.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Sure, why be interested in the worl..."
links.text: Sure, why be interested in the world around us. Get back to boring, brutal detective work.

links.title: You: ""Okay, let's put on a new record."..."
links.text: "Okay, let's put on a new record." (Conclude.)

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Let's.""
links.text: "Let's."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Oh yeah, you *get it*."
links.text: Oh yeah, you *get it*.

links.title: You: ""What are you going to *do* to me?""
links.text: "What are you going to *do* to me?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmh..." The lieutenant is not sati..."
links.text: "Hmh..." The lieutenant is not satisfied with the approach.

links.title: Elizabeth: ""What are we going to *do* to you?"..."
links.text: "What are we going to *do* to you?" She starts laughing. It's a cold laughter, devoid of joy.

links.title: Authority: "You were specifically asked *not* t..."
links.text: You were specifically asked *not* to say that -- and then you said it anyway. You junior delinquent! But you *still* did!

links.title: Elizabeth: ""The Union isn't going to *do* anyt..."
links.text: "The Union isn't going to *do* anything to you. It is not a crime syndicate, it is a labour organization."

links.title: Titus Hardie: ""Mhm..." A gruff humph from the tab..."
links.text: "Mhm..." A gruff humph from the table. "Goddamn right it is."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""If anything, it is the RCM who *do..."
links.text: "If anything, it is the RCM who *do* things to people..." She shakes her head. "But we digress."

links.title: Authority: "*Why* did you say that? Did you for..."
links.text: *Why* did you say that? Did you forget you're a cop... again?

links.title: You: ""Why are you so aggressive?""
links.text: "Why are you so aggressive?"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Aggressive? You make your living e..."
links.text: "Aggressive? You make your living enforcing violence. These people are just *dock workers*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""*Just dock workers*? Do dock worke..."
links.text: "*Just dock workers*? Do dock workers spy on the Police? We let you off easy, miss. Don't think it will happen again."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmh. So you were spying on us. And..."
links.text: "Hmh. So you were spying on us. And now you represent murder suspects -- *just dock workers*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Do dock workers spy on the Police?..."
links.text: "Do dock workers spy on the Police? You were on that corner all day. Now we know why." He smiles: "Just dock workers..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We've talked to Evrart Claire. We..."
links.text: "We've talked to Evrart Claire. We know who these men are. The Union's *militant* wing."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Listen, you Moralintern lackeys. Y..."
links.text: "Listen, you Moralintern lackeys. You're a mob, enforcing the unlawful privatization of Revachol. Twenty fat men in the Occident are stealing it all -- and you're their body guards."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""I'm being aggressive?" She raises..."
links.text: "I'm being aggressive?" She raises her eyebrows. "Listen, you Moralintern lackey, you're part of a mob, enforcing the unlawful privatization of Revachol. Twenty fat men in the Occident are stealing it all -- and you are their body guard."

links.title: Titus Hardie: ""Fuck yeah," the tall, broad should..."
links.text: "Fuck yeah," the tall, broad shouldered man takes a sip of his beer.

links.title: Elizabeth: ""So ask what you came to ask -- or..."
links.text: "So ask what you came to ask -- or get back to your commanders."

links.title: You: ""The world needs a financial buffer..."
links.text: "The world needs a financial buffer zone. No need to get emotional."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""No one is emotional here." Her exp..."
links.text: "No one is emotional here." Her expression stiffens further. "Do your *job*. Ask your questions -- then leave."

links.title: You: ""The privatization is not unlawful,..."
links.text: "The privatization is not unlawful, it's *cool* and *funny*. Maybe you're just not historic individuals?"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""I don't need privatization paeans..."
links.text: "I don't need privatization paeans from a rent-a-cop." Her expression stiffens. "Just do your *job*. Ask your questions. Then get out of Martinaise."

links.title: You: ""I don't know where you heard that,..."
links.text: "I don't know where you heard that, but it's wrong. The RCM is principled and *strong*, unlike you socialists."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Get sober." Her expression stiffen..."
links.text: "Get sober." Her expression stiffens. "Do your *job*. Ask your questions and get the hell out of Martinaise."

links.title: You: ""I liked that. Good start. Let's ta..."
links.text: "I liked that. Good start. Let's take it a step further -- armed uprising. What are the Union's plans?"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Look -- a comedian." Her expressio..."
links.text: "Look -- a comedian." Her expression stiffens. "Do your *job*. Ask your questions. Then get out of Martinaise."

links.title: Drama: "Strange. It's as if people don't be..."
links.text: Strange. It's as if people don't believe a cop could be a socialist revolutionary.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, let's do that. Let's ask tho..."
links.text: "Yeah, let's do that. Let's ask those questions."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Let's." Her expression stiffens."
links.text: "Let's." Her expression stiffens.

links.title: You: ""I should talk to Titus then!" [Lea..."
links.text: "I should talk to Titus then!" [Leave.]

links.title: Elizabeth: ""You should.""
links.text: "You should."

dialogueTree.title: Elizabeth: ""Let me handle this," the woman say..."
dialogueTree.text: "Let me handle this," the woman says to the crowd in the mess hall before turning to you...

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Officer Discotheque." She smiles c..."
links.text: "Officer Discotheque." She smiles coldly. "Still wondering if we listen to disco? We don't, by the way. We don't listen to disco anymore."

links.title: Drama: "Her entire character has shifted. T..."
links.text: Her entire character has shifted. This young woman is cold as ice.

links.title: You: ""You're the gardener!""
links.text: "You're the gardener!"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""No, I'm not a gardener, I'm a lega..."
links.text: "No, I'm not a gardener, I'm a legal counsellor for the Dockworkers' Union." She crosses her arms.

links.title: Elizabeth: ""So let's get to it -- you're looki..."
links.text: "So let's get to it -- you're looking for Titus Hardie. You think he has information that will help you. Maybe he does." She points to the man on her right.

links.title: You: ""You lied to me! You're *not* a gar..."
links.text: "You lied to me! You're *not* a gardener!"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""That's right, I'm not a gardener,..."
links.text: "That's right, I'm not a gardener, I'm a legal counsellor for the Dockworkers' Union." She crosses her arms.

links.title: You: ""I was just making an observation...."
links.text: "I was just making an observation. I was reacting to stimuli."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Sure, reacting to stimuli... I'm n..."
links.text: "Sure, reacting to stimuli... I'm not a gardener, by the way, I'm a legal counsellor for the Dockworkers' Union." She crosses her arms.

links.title: You: ""I just wanted to know what kind of..."
links.text: "I just wanted to know what kind of music you listen to. I was just curious!"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Sure, you were *curious*... I'm no..."
links.text: "Sure, you were *curious*... I'm not a gardener, by the way, I'm a legal counsellor for the Dockworkers' Union." She crosses her arms.

links.title: You: ""I just wanted to know more about t..."
links.text: "I just wanted to know more about the place before I check it out. That's normal."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Yes, extremely normal... I'm not a..."
links.text: "Yes, extremely normal... I'm not a gardener, by the way, I'm a legal counsellor for the Dockworkers' Union." She crosses her arms.

links.title: You: ""I mean no trouble, just here to do..."
links.text: "I mean no trouble, just here to do my job, that's all."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Of course, you were just doing you..."
links.text: "Of course, you were just doing your *job*... I'm not a gardener, by the way, I'm a legal counsellor for the Dockworkers' Union." She crosses her arms.

links.title: You: ""That's right, this is an epidermoc..."
links.text: "That's right, this is an epidermochromatic police officer. Deal with it."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Of course, and I'm just an epiderm..."
links.text: "Of course, and I'm just an epidermochromatic counsellor for the Dockworkers' Union," she says without blinking an eye.

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Detective Skin-Colour." She smiles..."
links.text: "Detective Skin-Colour." She smiles coldly. "I'm still black as you can see. Do you have any more keen-eyed observations?"

links.title: Drama: "Her entire character has shifted. T..."
links.text: Her entire character has shifted. This young woman is cold as ice.

links.title: Conceptualization: "She's right, you're basically an ep..."
links.text: She's right, you're basically an epidermochromatic police officer.

links.title: Elizabeth: ""Detective Disorientated." She smil..."
links.text: "Detective Disorientated." She smiles coldly. "Are you still wondering where you are? This is Martinaise, in case you've forgotten. I advise you not to overstay your welcome."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You seem a little different today...."
links.text: "You seem a little different today. Less hospitable."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""You're far from home, *lieutenants..."
links.text: "You're far from home, *lieutenants*... This isn't a district known for its love of self-proclaimed militiamen."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""You're far from home, *officer*......"
links.text: "You're far from home, *officer*... This isn't a district known for its love of self-proclaimed militiamen."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""You're far from home, *lieutenants..."
links.text: "You're far from home, *lieutenants*... This isn't a district known for its love of self-proclaimed militiamen."

links.title: You: ""You're not a gardener!""
links.text: "You're not a gardener!"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""That's right, I'm not a gardener,..."
links.text: "That's right, I'm not a gardener, I'm a legal counsellor for the Dockworkers' Union." It feels like she's waiting for a reaction of some sort.

links.title: You: ""Wait, and you are...?""
links.text: "Wait, and you are...?"

links.title: Elizabeth: ""I'm a legal counsellor for the Doc..."
links.text: "I'm a legal counsellor for the Dockworkers' Union. I've been watching you." It feels like she's waiting for a reaction of some sort.

links.title: You: ""Enough. Let's talk seriously.""
links.text: "Enough. Let's talk seriously."

links.title: Elizabeth: "Not a muscle moves in her face, but..."
links.text: Not a muscle moves in her face, but her eyes trace yours, stern and perceptive.

links.title: Elizabeth: ""You are looking for Titus Hardie,..."
links.text: "You are looking for Titus Hardie, who you think has information on a murder the RCM is investigating. You want to interview him." She points to the man standing in the middle of the room.

links.title: Elizabeth: ""That's Titus. Talk to him. But kno..."
links.text: "That's Titus. Talk to him. But know this: I'll be keeping an eye on you. No strong-arming, nothing official. The district of Martinaise does not recognize your authority to make arrests."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It doesn't matter if you recognize..."
links.text: "It doesn't matter if you recognize our authority. We will make an arrest if we have to."

links.title: Elizabeth: "She says nothing; her glare speaks..."
links.text: She says nothing; her glare speaks for her.

links.title: Logic: "Could this be the *Miss Beaufort* t..."
links.text: Could this be the *Miss Beaufort* that Easy Leo mentioned? The one Mr. Evrart sent to law school?

links.title: Logic: "Uhm...  you're sure Easy Leo mentio..."
links.text: Uhm...  you're sure Easy Leo mentioned something about a lawyer Elizabeth someone... but you're too *dumb* to remember what it was.

links.title: Authority: "How is that sign cleanup going, huh..."
links.text: How is that sign cleanup going, huh? Fuck the police and all that? She said she would clean it.

links.title: You: ""I mean no trouble, I'm here to do..."
links.text: "I mean no trouble, I'm here to do my job, that's all."

links.title: You: ""You're right, lieutenant, she did..."
links.text: "You're right, lieutenant, she did seem friendlier sitting on that corner."

links.title: Elizabeth: ""You're far from home, *officer*......"
links.text: "You're far from home, *officer*... This isn't a district known for its love of self-proclaimed militiamen."
